org.x2d.zuul
Class CommandWord

java.lang.Object
  org.x2d.zuul.CommandWord
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommandGo, CommandHelp, CommandList, CommandLoad, CommandRead, CommandSave, CommandTake, CommandTalk, CommandUnlock, CommandUse
public abstract class CommandWord
extends java.lang.Object

Command word class. This class should be used as a super class for all command words. There are two kinds of commands. The first type does not need a target. These commands only need to override the executeCommand(String target) method. The second type does need a target and then the executeCommand(String target), mustHaveTarget() and getTargets() must be overriden. Here comes an example: 

public class CommandMyCommand extends CommandWord {
    public CommandMyCommand(String commandName) {
        super(commandName);
    }
    @Override
    public String[] getTargets(Game game) {
        return new String[0]; //Should be a list of possible targets
    }
    @Override
    public void executeCommand(Game game, String target) {
        //Something that should happen when this command word is used
    }
}

executeCommand

public abstract void executeCommand(Game game,
                                    java.lang.String target)
Should be overriden. It's here the command gets executed.

Parameters:
game - The game.
target - The target.

getTargets

public java.lang.String[] getTargets(Game game)
Returns an array with all the possible targets at the current time. This method should be overriden if the command needs a target.

Returns:
An array wih all the current possible targets for this command.

mustHaveTarget

public boolean mustHaveTarget()
Should be overriden to say if this command needs a target to work.

Returns:
If this command must have a target.
